ETYMOLOGY: From Old French praerie, from Latin pratum 'meadow'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large open area of grassland, especially in North America, with few or no trees.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （尤指北美洲的）大草原，牧场，无树大草地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Buffalo once roamed freely across the vast prairies of the American Midwest.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 野牛曾在美国中西部广阔的大草原上自由漫步。
